About Gen Digital:Just like we want to empower our customers, it’s important at Gen that team members have the support they need to do their best work. This includes flexible working options with generous time off, and competitive benefits and compensation packages. Diversity, equity, and inclusion are foundational to how we do business, and we strive to create safe, inclusive spaces where all employees are valued, respected, and celebrated for their individual differences and unique perspectives. Employment decisions are based on merit, experience, and business needs. Gen is an equal employment opportunity employer.About the Role:The Sr. Director, Analytics & Data Science is a strategic leader in helping to build a data-driven culture in the Consumer Business Unit at Gen.This person will work closely with both the Finance and Go to Market/Commercial teams as well as various Product & Data teams to enable and analyze end-to-end scalable customer experiences and levers for business growth.The person in this role will lead the global analytics & data science teams to drive insights and uncover areas for customer acquisition, retention rate optimization, as well as be accountable for the successful completion of many strategic product initiatives.Sr. Director, Analytics & Data Science will be responsible for ensuring the team includes the integration of quantitative and qualitative insights for testing, optimization and business analytics.This will include informing a compelling vision and strategy for a scaling analytics function, including recruiting, teaching, challenging, and connecting in the full breadth of analytics to help optimize ROI across marketing channels, lower customer churn, improve customer service and provide deep insights to aid company objectives of sales, growth, profitability, and market visibility.Responsibilities:Work with the GTM and Product Marketing leaders as a strong business partner to help define the marketing strategy that optimizes our execution across all marketing channelsArchitect analytics strategy and provide best practices and instrumentation requirements for full breadth of analytics needs – including clear, concise business performance and adhoc business analysis, all the way through growth vector identification used for strategic business planningDevelop predictive models that aid in optimization and accurate projections of spend outcomesMonetization optimization analyticsEnable and teach self-service analytics to stakeholders through sharp reporting and dashboardsAugment, refine and evangelize measurement frameworks to make intelligent, informed recommendations and decisions regarding our digital marketing strategies, plans and investments.Recruit, retain, invest in, and scale a best-in-class global analytics teamCreate and communicate and represent best practices across the company and the industryThought partner with the leadership team to ensure strategic and timely spend allocation decisionsQualifications:Bachelor’s Degree in marketing, engineering, finance, stats or related field required; Master's preferredMinimum 15 years experience in marketing of products and/or services and/or business analysisMinimum 10 years of management responsibilityMulti-distribution channel experience is strongly preferredAbility to communicate technical topics and analytical insights to sr management and the marketing team as a wholeProven experience in building innovative, proactive, high-impact marketing campaigns utilizing all relevant channels and media; and aligning strategy with business goalsProven ability to drive revenue through creative sales channels and marketing programs. Creative thinker with the ability to provide both strategic and tactical directionProven ability to develop and manage budgetsExceptional negotiation and written and verbal communication/presentation skills; and a strong bias toward execution (results-oriented)Proven background in technology-based marketingAbility to protect all forms of highly confidential and proprietary business information and ability to maintain the highest standards of privacy and securityAbility to follow and abide by all information and security policies and practicesGen is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive and accessible environment for all employees. All employment decisions are based on merit, experience, and business needs, without regard to race, color, national origin, age, religion, sex, pregnancy (including childbirth or related medical conditions), genetic information, disability (physical or mental), medical condition, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or gender expression, military or veteran status, or any other consideration made unlawful by federal, state, or local law. Gen strictly prohibits unlawful discrimination based on such protected characteristics and seeks to recruit the most talented candidates from diverse cultures and backgrounds.We also consider employment-qualified individuals with arrest and conviction records. In addition, we will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. Learn more about pay transparency.Gen complies with all anti-discrimination laws.To conform to U.S. export control regulations, applicant should be eligible for any required authorizations from the U.S. Government.
